scenes.location: BRIDGE USS SARATOGA FAVORING THE CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is a concerned Starfleet professional. Her male SCIENCE OFFICER stands beside her. CREDITS RESUME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet Command, this is USS Saratoga patrolling Sector 5, neutral zone. We are tracking a probe of unknown origin on apparent trajectory to the Terran solar system. Attempts to communicate with the probe have been negative on all known frequencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue tracking, Saratoga. We will analyze transmissions and advise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Starfleet, Saratoga out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range 400,000 kilometers, closing. (GIBBERISH starts) Here it comes again. The CALL, louder this time. As they listen, the Bridge lights begin to dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's causing that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, their call is being carried on an amplification wave of enormous power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you isolate the wave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. It's impacting on all our systems! Even as he speaks, the GIBBERISH increases in volume and the lights on the bridge dip lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow alert! Shields up. Helm, reduce closing speed! The Helmsman attempts to comply. Nothing works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Thruster controls have been neutralized!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency Thrusters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries, then) No response, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The distance closes rapidly; the Probe's size is getting awesome; the GIBBERISH resumes, loud...

dialogues.speaker: SARATOGA BRIDGE
dialogues.text: As the Gibberish reaches a loud climax, the lights go out entirely, along with all engine and electronic sounds. In the sudden darkness:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency lights! Very low level lights; baffled faces; systems Checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage report!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... All systems have failed... We are functioning on reserve power only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out of control -- Rig for collision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it bears down on Saratoga, and passes massively overhead, endlessly; The Probe is now recognized as miles long. It passes now, and goes off into the dis- tance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) They've finished us. And we don't even know what they want... The Captain considers this, turns to the Comm Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me whatever you've got on the emergency channel. (then) Starfleet Command, this is Saratoga. Can you hear me...? Come in, please... Come in, please...

dialogues.speaker: 7B SPACE
dialogues.text: Disappearing in the distance. The GIBBERISH begins faintly, ominously again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The City of the 23rd Century, the Golden Gate Bridge: PUSH IN to Federation Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FEET Hurrying over marble floors, as CREDITS CONTINUE. PAN UP now to reveal SAREK, Spock's father, moving OUT OF SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we PAN Sarek INTO SHOT with COMMANDER CHAPEL, Starfleet Medical Officer whose history in Star Trek is known to all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming. It's not going well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I to late to testify?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Sarek raises an eyebrow, as they start out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sarek and Chapel enter in semi-darkness, while events are taking place O.S. They look in wonder at:

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: As it comes toward us, only to be wrecked and torn apart by a series of explosions.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SAREK, CHAPEL
dialogues.text: Awed, seeing this for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Enterprise streaks to its fiery death, watched in LONG SHOT by Kirk and crew. Then as Kirk's face is seen, CLOSE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Hold the image, hold! As Kirk's image FREEZES, PULL BACK to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doomed room in which the FEDERATION COUNCIL and its PRESIDENT sit at a long table before the Federation Seal. There is a gallery of representatives from vari- ous planets. The screen on which Kirk's image is frozen is centrally located. And at a spot lit glass podium, stands the KLINGON AMBASSADOR, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold! The quintessential devil in these matters! James T. Kirk, renegade and terrorist! Not only is he responsible for the murder of a Klingon crew; the theft of a Klingon vessel. See now the real plot and intentions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, ON SCREEN, introduces the Genesis Device and its awesome visuals (STAR TREK II AND III). Many people in the room have never seen the secret material and react accordingly. And the Klingon continues his tirade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even as the Federation negotiated a peace treaty with us, Kirk was secretly developing the Genesis torpedo! Conceived by Kirk's son and test detonated by the Admiral himself! (the proof is on screen) The result of this awesome energy was euphemistically called "The Genesis Planet..." A secret base from which to launch the. annihilation of the Klingon people! (as the audience stirs) We demand the extradition of Kirk! We demand justice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon justice is a unique point of view, Mr. President. As the audience stirs, Sarek descends the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Genesis was perfectly named: The creation of life not death. It was the Klingons who had first blood while trying to possess its secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vulcans are well known as the intellectual puppets of the Federation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) Your vessel did destroy U.S.S. Grissom. Your men did kill Kirk's son. Do you deny these events?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We deny nothing! We have the right to preserve our race!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the right to murder? The gallery erupts in reaction and the Council President gavels them to silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order. There will be no further outbursts from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches a podium) Mr. President, I have come to speak on behalf of the accused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal bias! His son was saved by Kirk! The President remains calm amid the buzzing. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ambassador, with all respect, the Council's deliberations are over. You have been allowed to speak in order to put your views on the record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Kirk goes unpunished?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Kirk has been charged with nine violations of Starfleet regulations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet regulations? Outrageous! (then) Remember this well: there will be no peace as long as Kirk lives! And with a flourish, he exits with his staff as the assembly murmurs. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek of Vulcan, with all respect -- we ask you to return Kirk and his crew to answer for their crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With respect to you, Mr. President, there is only one crime: denying Kirk and his crew the honors they so richly deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You are welcome to remain and testify. He gavels the meeting to its end. CREDITS CONCLUDE.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: A great red sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's Log, Stardate 8390...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES IN. The Klingon ship rests on its landing pad; the crew gathered outside as in a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in the third month of our Vulcan exile. We are uncertain about the progress of Captain Spock's memory training.. And it was Doctor McCoy with a fine sense  of historical irony, who decided on a name for our captured Klingon vessel.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY
dialogues.text: The words "H.M.S. BOUNTY" have been hand painted on the side of the open bay doors. CAMERA MOVES toward the gathered Captain and Crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And like those mutineers of 500 years ago, we too have a hard choice to make. A choice made harder because we are all too old to suffer fools gladly... Nevertheless: CAMERA PANS: as Kirk calls the roll: BONES... SCOTTY... UHURA... CHEKOV... SULU. Each raises a hand and holds it. Kirk now says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the record show that the Commander and the crew of the late Starship Enterprise have voted unanimously to return to Earth to face the consequences of their actions in the rescue of their comrade, Captain Spock. (a long beat) Thank you all... Repair stations, please. As they disperse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, how soon can we get underway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one more day, sir. The damage control is easy. Reading Klingon is hard. Kirk nods, Scotty heads inside. Bones hangs back sourly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think they could at least send a ship. Bad enough to be court marshaled and spend the rest of our lives mining borite -- but to come home in this Klingon flea trap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could learn a thing or two from this flea trap. It has a cloaking  device that cost us a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish we could cloak the stench. And he starts off. WIDEN as Kirk turns to LT. SAAVIK, dressed in Vulcan attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, I'd like to continue my work on the ship until you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lt. Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (produces disc) And... Here is a deposition I have made. If it is not sufficient, I will return to Earth to testify.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't concern yourself, Saavik. Your leave has been granted for good and proper cause. (a beat) How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am well, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be in good hands here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a look, and she starts in, leaving him alone in thought. Then he slowly, almost secretly looks upward: he stares uncertainly at the mountain above.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PROMONTORY ABOVE
dialogues.text: We SLOW ZOOM to the hooded figure. It is SPOCK watching impassively. After a long moment, he turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: THREE SCREENS
dialogues.text: They form a computer console like a great pipe organ, with a bank of keys. On each screen are the words: MEMORY TESTING INTERRUPTED." PULL BACK as Spock enters, sits thoughtfully,. Then he places a small lightweight headset on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resume. What follows happens rapidly: Questions appear on all three screens. The tempo increases through the sequence to a crescendo. Spock takes it all on in stride, answering questions by keyboard, or verbally, without being flapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  What is the molecular formula of Yominum Sulfide crystals?  (A.  K4YM3 (SO73 Es 2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  Who said, "Logic is the cement of our civilization with which we ascend from chaos using reason as our guide?"  (A.  T'plana-Hath, matron of Vulcan philosophy.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  What significant legal precedent arose from the peace pact between Argus and Rigel IV?  (A.  All beings may not be created equal yet shall be given equal opportunity and treatment under the law.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  Solve:  (a graphic of 3-dimensional chess)  (A.   White Queen to section 5, grid 6. Queen takes Knight. Rook takes Queen. White pawn to section 5, grid 7, pawn takes Rook. Checkmate.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  What was Kiri-kin-tha's first law of metaphysics? (A.  Nothing unreal exists.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  Adjust the sine wave of this magnetic envelope so that anti-neutrons can pass through it but anti- gravitons cannot.  (A.   Spock works keypad and the image of the envelope is changed on one of the screens.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  What is the electronic configuration of Gadolinium? (A.   Spock types, in one second: 5s22s22p63d104s24p6 4d104f75s25p64d16s2.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  Identify: (an image appears)  (A.   A Klingon mum- mification glyph from the earliest part of the Zanxthkolt dynasty.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  What were the principle historical events on the planet Earth in the year 1987?  (A.   Spock types, but things are going too fast for us to see the answer.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  What significant contribution to bio-engineering was made on the Loonkerian outpost on Klendth?  (A.   The universal atmospheric element compensator.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  What is this a model of?  (A.   A three dimensional theoretical representation of a four dimensional time gate as proposed by the Andorian scientist, Shres.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  Where were the first conclusive advances made on toroidal space-time distortion and by whom?  (A.   At Cambridge, Massachusetts, Earth, in 2052 by Ralph Seron.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q.  Evaluate and conclude: A starship's sensors indi- cate it is being pursued so closely that it occupies the same space as its pursuer.  (A.   The warp drive regulators are creating a parallex matter echo.) Abruptly, the hectic pace stops, there is a beat of silence; then, on all three screens comes the legend: MEMORY TEST SATISFACTORY. Then: READY FOR FINAL QUESTION. Spock is ready. HOW DO YOU FEELO? Spock sees it on all three screens and seems baffled. The question begins to flash impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not understand. He stares at the flashing question. He becomes aware of someone in the room. He turns to see his mother, AMANDA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I do not understand the final question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are half human. The Computer knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is irrelevant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock... The retraining of your mind has been in the Vulcan way, so you may not understand feelings. But as my son, you have them. They will surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish, since you deem them of value. But I cannot wait here to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where must you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Earth. To offer testimony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopefully) You do this -- for friendship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do this because I was there,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) Spock. Does the good of the many outweigh the good of the one...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would accept that as an axiom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you stand here alive because of a mistake -- made by your flawed, feeling, human friends. They have sacrificed their futures because they believed that the good of the one -- you -- was more important to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) Humans make illogical decisions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... They do, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock cocks his head, still baffled by this contradiction.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: It passes CAMERA innocently emitting its CALL. No cause for alarm. Except as the Probe passes into the distance, we see it is headed directly for the blue marble, Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is shining. MOVE, along the Golden Gate Bridge, toward Starfleet Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large windows overlook the bay. But in the midsection of the room, hi-tech displays monitor the universe. The scene, and the tension are feverish. One of the communicators is LT. RAND formerly of the Enterprise crew. Commander Chapel is also present. A verbal babble, and visual reports at hectic pace. ADMIRAL MORROW, Starfleet Commander, presides. The Council President enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Status report, Admiral!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, the Probe has passed through all quadrants. The starships Shepard and Yorktown and three smaller vessels have been neutralized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Neutralized?" How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know. It's using forms of energy our best scientists do not understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you protect us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are launching everything we have. As the President reacts to this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great rotating satellite, home of grand Spaceships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CONTROLLERS, back to us, sit in the control seats. They control several Starships in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excelsior and Intrepid are cleared to depart. Open space dock doors. Over this, the SOUND OF THE PROBE'S SIGNAL is heard. Almost immediately, Controller Two is in big trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! Space dock doors are inoperative!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep trying. (then) Excelsior and Intrepid stand by! Malfunction on exit doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control, Intrepid. Never mind. We can't get powered up! The Two Controllers look at each other as the SOUND OF the Probe's GIBBERISH comes in at DEAFENING VOLUME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space doors not responding. All Emergency systems are non- functional. All over Space dock, lights are dimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engage reserve power. Starfleet Command, this is Space dock on emergency channel. We have lost all internal power. Repeat, we have lost all power!...

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The Probe's thrusters fire, and it slows to orbit the blue marble below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the antennae rotate to face the Earth. As the GIB- BERISH comes on, LOUD:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An amazing EFFECT: The SOUND, like the prow of an invisible boat, cuts the surface of the ocean, leaving not a wake of water -- but of rising CLOUDS.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: We INTERCUT between the Probe's transmissions and the impact on the water surfaces of Earth to create a clear impression: CLOUD COVER is slowly forming as ocean water is being transformed into cloud vapor by the SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dignitaries are stunned to see the cloud cover totally enveloping their planet.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. VULCAN SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Long shadows over the red planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The " HMS BOUNTY" sits alone in the morning light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renovated and spruced up by the Enterprise crew. CAMERA FOLLOWS Kirk as he inspects the pre-launch activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Systems report.  Communications?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communications Systems ready. Communications Officer -- ready as she'll ever be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guidance is functional. Onboard Computer will interface with Federation memory bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons systems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operational, Admiral. Cloaking Device now available in all modes  of flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed, Mr. Chekov. A lot of effort for a short voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) We are in an enemy wessel, sir. I didn't wish to be shot down on thee way to our own funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most prudent. (comm. button) Engine room. Report, Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first look in this cavern. In addition to the  transporter and engine areas, there is a large Cargo hold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready, sir. I've converted the Dilithium Sequencer to something less primitive. And Admiral -- I've replaced the Klingon Food Packs. They was givin' me sour stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciated by all, Mr. Scott. (then) Prepare for departure. As the crew chatters through the pre-launch check list, Kirk crosses to Saavik, near the exit doors, her work finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, Saavik. I guess this is goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Admiral. (then, stiffly) Sir. I have not had the opportunity to tell you about your son. (then) David died most bravely. He saved Spock. He saved us all... I thought you should know. Kirk wants to know, but is deeply moved. At last he reaches for her shoulders, holds on affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, they separate. We FOLLOW Saavik to the garb, stands in the open doorway looking back at Saavik. A moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Good day, Captain Spock... May your journey be free of incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live long and prosper, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at Kirk for the briefest moment, then exits. Spock has started forward to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to come aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Spock, Jim. Remember...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be improper to refer to you as Jim while you are in command, Admiral... Also, I must apologize for my attire. (befuddled) I seem to have misplaced my uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... find that understandable (at Spock's eyebrow) I mean, you've been through a lot. (then) Station, please. Spock nods, and somewhat rigidly crosses to the Science station. Kirk watches, uncertain. Bones is suddenly by his side, whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this is such a bright idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean him, back at his post, like nothing happened. I don't know if you'd got the whole picture but he isn't exactly working on all thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? (Kirk isn't) That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu... Take us home... The whine of the energizers begins, the engines come alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Saavik walks away without looking back. The wind and ROAR of the engines. She walks to a waiting Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROAR and a belch of rocketry, the Bird of Prey lifts off, and starts its journey.

dialogues.speaker: SAAVIK AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: Wind blown, they watch as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bird disappears among the canyons of Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK It is bedlam. Data is pouring in from every corner of the Earth. All the visuals and audio reports combine to create a trend that is inescapable:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juneau, Alaska, cloud cover increased to 95 percent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tokyo, total cloud cover. All power is from reserve banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leningrad has lost electrical power. Cloud cover 100 percent. Temperatures dropping rapidly. As the reports continue on SCREENS and on SOUND:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is estimate cloud cover of the Planet at this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93.2 percent. Probe now orbiting South Pacific. Estimate total cloud cover by next orbit. No known way to dissipate cloud cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notify all stations: Starfleet Emergency, Red Alert. Switch power immediately to Planetary Reserves. The SOUND OF THE PROBE is heard throughout, like the death knell. Morrow turns to the President and says privately:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, even with Planetary Reserves we cannot survive without the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am well aware of that, Admiral. Now the President steps to the great window, where Sarek is watching the world of San Francisco. Rain has begun to streak the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarek... Is there no answer we can give this Probe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is difficult to answer if you do not understand the question. (then) Mr. President, perhaps you should transmit a planet distress signal, while we still have time. The President looks at Sarek deeply. If his old wise friend has no answer, what hope is there...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it passes us at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimating Planet Earth one point six hours present speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue on course. Chekov, any signs of Federation escort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. And no Federation wessels on assigned patrol stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's odd. Uhura, what's on the Comm channels...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled by headset) Very active, Sir. Multi-phasic transmissions, overlapping.... almost a gibberish... (a beat) Let me see if I can sort it out. She sets to work, intently: Spock reacts, picks up an earpiece to listen in, perhaps be helpful.

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: He sees Spock at science station, takes this opportunity to walk to his old comrade, break the silence of months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... Busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura is busy. I am monitoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm. Well, just wanted to say -- nice to have your katra back in your head, not mine. (He smiles; Spock stares) I mean, I may have carried your soul, but I sure couldn't fill your shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... My shoes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it... (a new tack) How 'bout covering a little philosophical ground? Life, Death, Life... Things of that nature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not have time on Vulcan to review the Philosophical disciplines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, it's me, Bones! I mean our experience was unique. You really have gone where no man has gone  before. Can't you tell me what it felt like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be impossible to discuss the subject without a common frame of reference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A joke is a story with a humorous climax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I have to die to discuss your insights on death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re earpiece) Pardon me, Doctor, I am hearing many calls of distress. Bones is enraged and frustrated by this as we go to:

dialogues.speaker: 47A FAVORING UHURAH'S STATION
dialogues.text: As Kirk arrives in response to her wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overlapping distress calls. Some from Starships... others...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen! ON SCREEN, we have the option of playing FRAGMENTS of distress calls from SARATOGA, and other VESSELS. But these fragments are ultimately superceded by the tearing image of the FEDERATION PRESIDENT. Some of his message will be obscured until Uhura can find a balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is... President of... Grave Warning: Do not approach Planet Earth... To all Starships, repeat, do not approach! (as Crew reacts) ... Orbiting Probe... emits transmissions on energy wave unknown to us... Wave, directed at our oceans... Ionized our atmosphere... All power sources have failed. Starships are powerless. (clearing now) ... A cloud envelope has enveloped the Planet. Heavy rain and flooding. Temperature dropping to critical level. Planet cannot survive unless Probe is responded to... Probe transmissions dominate all standard channels. Communications may not be possible... Save yourselves. Avoid the Planet Earth... Farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock? What do you make of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most unusual. An unknown form of energy of great intelligence and power. I find it illogical that its intentions are hostile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping sarcasm) Really? You think this is its way of saying "Hi there" to the people of the Earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are millions of other species on Earth, Doctor. Only human arrogance would assume the message was meant for man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk, aside:) I liked him better before he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Jim, they've made him into a goddam green-blooded computer! And as Bones stalks off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock -- you're suggesting the transmission is meant for life form other than man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distinct possibility, Admiral. The President did say the transmission was directed at the Earth's Oceans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura... Can you modify the Probe's signals by accounting for density temperature and salinity factors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try, sir. Now begins a virtuoso performance by Uhura:  a series of SOUND CHANGES accounting for all the factors; a feeling of a deductive process, modifying the GIBBERISH by slowing it down and changing it, until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I think I have it, sir. The Bridge is filled with a SOUND familiar to some in our audience, but baffling to our 23rd Century friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Uhura) Then, this is what it would sound like underwater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinating. If my suspicion is correct, there can be no response to this message. As this impacts, he rises abruptly and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns) To the on-board computer room. To confirm my suspicion. Spock turns and is gone. Beat; Kirk starts after him followed by Bones. Kirk turns back to Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way -- somebody has to keep an eye on him!

dialogues.speaker: THE ORBITING PROBE
dialogues.text: The ultimate condition statement: below the Probe, the Planet has become a grey-black enshrouded ball. Pinpoint lightning flashes can be seen as tiny Christmas lights. And the Probe's SOUND goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the din of the Probe's call and the shouts and chatter of officers, the screens convey a series of terrible images, some deteriorating: -- Clouds, tumbling abnormally in response to the Probe's call, build up massive thunderheads, split by LIGHTNING and THUNDER. -- A familiar Landmark (The Leaning Tower, The Sphinx) is seen against grey-black tumbling clouds. Rain has begun to fall heavily. The Sphinx appears to be crying. -- A dam cracks, and torrents of water pour into the valley below, all under leaden skies. -- SAN FRANCISCO BAY: Dark with giant clouds, whipping wind and rain. Lightning crackles on top the Golden Gate. As  we WIDEN from the screen, we are in the midst of Bedlam. Morrow, trying to chatter orders, the President trying vainly to be heard on a comm channel, Commander Chapel urgently directing medical and evacuation efforts. (DIALOGUE TO COME)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain howls outside, and water is beginning to spray in through the seals. A CREW, drenched, is attempting to shore up the window itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Probe's modified CALL is heard (WHALE SONG), a series of graphic images present themselves on screen; The computer search narrows down to whales, and then,  specific species thereof. In short order the computer finds a match, and a line drawing of a great whale appears. A printout indicates: "Megaptera Novaeangliae." As this is occurring, ANGLE WIDENS to include Kirk and Bones watching intently behind Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As suspected, the Probe's transmissions are the songs sung by whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whales? On Screen: "HUMPBACK WHALE" begins flashing to replace the Latin species name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specifically, Humpback Whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy! Who would send a probe hundreds of light years to talk to a whale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reflects) It's possible. Whales were on Earth far earlier than man... As DATA continues to flash on screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 million years earlier. Humpbacks were heavily hunted by Man. They have been extinct since the 21st Century... It is possible that an alien intelligence sent the probe to determine why they lost contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, could the Humpback's answer to this call be simulated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds, but not the language. We would be responding in gibberish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any other planet where this species exists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humpback was indigenous to Earth. Earth of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That leaves us no choice. We must destroy the probe before it destroys Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be futile, Admiral. The probe would neutralize us easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can't turn away! Is there no alternative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one, but I cannot guarantee its success. We could attempt to find some Humpback Whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said there aren't any except on Earth of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is what I said, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how.? He trails off, seeing Kirk deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now wait just a damn minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, start your computations for time warp. (a beat) Come on, Bones. Let's pay Scotty a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: striding through a vast Cargo area. Bones follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, how long is this bay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 60 feet, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should be enough. Can you enclose it to hold water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I can, sir; are you planning to take a swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the deep end, Mr. Scott. As Scotty puzzles -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, we have to find some Humpbacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Humpbacked - people.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whales, Scotty. 45 to 50 feet long; about 40 tons a piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral - how am I going to handle all that weight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll work it out, Scotty. And remember: two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes two to tango, Mr. Scott. And with a confident grin, Kirk exits, pursued by Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great flood and Noah's Ark. what a way to finally go.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARGO BAY
dialogues.text: As Bones catches up with Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really going to try this time travel in this rust bucket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, slingshot around the Sun. If you pick up enough speed you're in time warp. If you don't, you fry..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you prefer to do nothing? And Kirk passes through the Cargo Bay into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones pursues Kirk on the way to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer a dose of common sense. you are proposing to head backwards in time, find Humpback Whales, then bring them forward in time, drop them off - and hope they tell this Probe what to do with itself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That's the general idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a better idea - now's the time. There is a pause. Bones does not have a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open, Kirk strides in, Bones following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock, your computations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In progress, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura. Get me through to Starfleet  Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waves crash against the bridge posts and the shoreline. Wind roars: Lightning, thunder, crackle and rumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torrential rain at the window; lightning reflects deep into the room. The situation screens have become erratic; technicians scurry desperately and there is CHATTER overlapping from all. Through this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... I'm picking up a faint  transmission... It's Admiral Kirk calling...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen! But at this moment, the entire situation display goes fuzzy, distorts, and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Satellite reserve power, now! The board starts up again, but dimmer, more erratic. A distorted image of Kirk appears on SCREEN (INTERCUT WITH BIRD OF PREY). We will not hear every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Analysis... Probe call... Captain Spock... Opinion... extinct species, Humpback Whale... proper response... Do you read me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stabilize! Emergency reserve! As the Comm Officer responds, Sarek steps up beside Morrow. Now Kirk's image clears enough to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet, if you read, we are going to attempt time travel. We are computing our trajectory at this time... But suddenly the power fails, Kirk's image is gone. A silence as they stare at the blank screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Good luck, Kirk. And all you go with you. The interruption is sudden: the entire great window facing the bay CRASHES INWARD, filling the room with debris, cries, and howling wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cloud covered Earth is distant b.g. The ship passes us. PAN to see she's heading for the Sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to engage computer, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is our target in time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The late 20th Century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you can be more specific...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with this equipment. I have had to program some of the variables from memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the variables...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Availability of fuel components; Mass of the vessel through a time continuum, and the probable location of Humpbacks, in this case, the Pacific basin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've programmed that from memory...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes to heaven) Angels and ministers of grace, defend us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamlet, Act I scene 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock... None of us has doubts about your memory. (then) Engage computer. Prepare for Warp Speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her wings move to their sleekest position as she con- tinues her course to the Sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields, Mr. Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields, aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May fortune favor the foolish. (then) Mr. Sulu, Warp Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey explodes into WARP; she blurs past our eyes several times, gaining speed toward the Sun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp two... three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady as she goes... On VIEW SCREEN the sun is getting larger. Vibration begins on the bridge and increases markedly with speed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp five... seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she'll hold together, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No choice now, Scotty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, heat shields at maximum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp Nine... Nine point two... Nine point three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, we need breakaway speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, sir... Nine point seven... point eight... Breakaway threshold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady!!... (cues from SCREEN) Now, Mr. Sulu!

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: -- Just as the Bird appears certain to be swallowed by the Sun, a BLAST of some kind accelerates the ship along the far curve of the great star. Solar flares lick at the bright blur as she -- -- Arcs suddenly behind the sun, whipping almost faster than we can see and -- -- Like a tracer bullet on a circular course, the bright blur emerges from the opposite side of the sun and starts back toward Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are behind the ship, chasing and closing rapidly as it sizzles through space. We overtake the ship until the blue white heat of the engines FILLS THE SCREEN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM THE REAR as CAMERA CONTINUES MOVING IN toward Kirk sitting in his chair. As the back of Kirk's head FILLS THE SCREEN:

dialogues.speaker: TIME TRAVEL SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: We are inside Kirk's MIND as we see a series of hypnot- ic dream images floating up from Kirk's subconscious; undulating figures which float toward us and pass... Liquid faces... amorphous figures... images of Kirk's shipmates in semi-transparent ghostly shapes -- aging and regressing. Kirk's image of himself running toward himself... underwater looking up at a sunlight-dappled surface... gently waving strands of reeds at an abstract shoreline... disembodied voices, sounds and music add to the hypnotic effect. And then... A WHOOSHING ROAR begins to mount and grow louder until it climaxes with a terrible BANG! And we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty a moment, then the Bird of Prey descends INTO THE SHOT, no longer glowing, tranquil in flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu...? ... Mr. Sulu?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of trance) ... Aye sir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is our condition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... Braking thrusters seem to have fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture, please. ON SCREEN: The spectacle of Earth as seen from high orbit (NASA MATERIAL). Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Earth... But when?... Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at his station) Judging by the pollution content of the atmosphere, I believe we have arrived at the late 20th Century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Mr. Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, I am receiving whale songs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On speakers. Sure enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Home in on the strongest signal. Descend from orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, if I may: we're probably already visible to the tracking devices of the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite right, Spock. Mr. Chekov, engage cloaking device!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Descending, the ship, via the cloaking device, disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are crossing the terminator into night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homing in on the west coast of North America...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Individual whale song getting stronger... This is strange, Admiral. The song is directly ahead. It's coming from San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a city? That doesn't make  sense....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps thy are stranded in the Bay, sir?... Or in captivity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, you and Spock better get down here...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) Continue approach...

dialogues.speaker: POWER CONSOLE
dialogues.text: (AS SHOT) Within a shielded sub-room, we can see through a window dilithium crystals. They are beautiful, but they're dim. WIDEN as Scotty tells Kirk and Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're giving out. De-crystallizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a round figure, Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, twenty-four hours, give or take, staying cloaked. After that, Admiral, we'll be visible -- and dead in the water. In any case, we won't have enough to break out of the Earth's gravity, to say nothing of getting back home. Kirk scowls at the crystals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we've come this far only to be stopped by this! (thinks) Scotty, is there any way dilithium can be re-crystallized?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. We can't even do that in the 23rd Century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a 20th Century possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If memory serves, there was a  dubious flirtation with nuclear fission reactors resulting in toxic side effects. By the beginning of the fusion era, these reactors had been replaced, but at this time, we should be able to find some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said toxic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could rig a device to collect their high energy photons safely; we could then inject the photons into the dilithium chamber, causing crystalline restructure.... Theoretically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would we find these reactors... Theoretically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuclear power was widely used in naval vessels... Kirk looks at him, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city, alive with lights. We are descending.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The FOOTAGE is seen on screen. Kirk is on station. They are all watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't look all that different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope so, Bones. Mr. Sulu, set us down in Golden Gate Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Descending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll divide into teams. Commanders Chekov and Uhura are assigned to the Uranium problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. McCoy, you, Mr. Scott and Commander Sulu will convert us a whale tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Spock and I will attempt to trace these whale songs to their source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have bearing and distance for you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (then) Now look: I want you all to be very careful. This is terra incognita. Many customs will doubtless take us by surprise. It's a forgone conclusion these people have never seen an extra-terrestrial before. Everyone looks at Spock. He arches an eyebrow; reaches into his robe and pulls out a strip of lining which he ties around his head, concealing his ears and making him look like a Japanese gentleman in samurai dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This is an extremely primitive and paranoid culture. Mr. Chekov, issue a phaser and communicator to each  team. (then) We'll maintain radio silence except in emergency, all transmissions to be preceded by three coded bleeps. Anyone in uniform, get rid of your rank insignia. (they do) Any questions? (then) All right, let's do our job and get out of here. Our own world is waiting for us to save it if we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A garbage truck is stopped as TWO GARBAGE MEN empty park trash cans into the rear of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I told her: if you think I'm laying out sixty bucks for a goddam toaster oven you got another thing coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what'd she say? Before he can answer, a mighty wind comes up. We're talking Hurricane Gloria at 150 m.p.h. It's all they can do to hang on to the truck for dear life, squinting in the direction of the wind. After a couple of moments, the wind dies as quickly as it arose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that? But both are now taken by a WEIRD SOUND, and they look to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ramp of the Bird of Prey descends, the only visible part of the ship. Kirk and his crew descend, back-lit.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: The garbage men stare in disbelief. Number One starts for the cab, grabs Number Two, who's frozen, and they scramble into the truck, fumble for the starter, and roar away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. And neither did you, so shut up.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAMP
dialogues.text: As the truck roars off in the distance, Kirk and the crew reach the ground. The ramp closes, restoring normal light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stick together till we get orientated. Bearing to the whales?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with tricorder) 283 degrees... 15.2 kilometers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone remember where we parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they move off.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Culture shock! Bustling traffic and people. Our doughty band moves through the scene in awe and wonder, taking in sights and sounds. They are little noticed by passersby; their dress may be a little odd, but this is San Francisco. Now they stop in front of a news machine.

dialogues.speaker: THE HEADLINE, SAN FRANCISCO CHRONICLE
dialogues.text: "Nuclear Arms Talks Stalled."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a miracle these people ever got out of the 23rd century. A man steps to the machine, inserts coins, takes a paper. Kirk frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, they're still using money. We're going to need some. He looks around in thought, sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people wait here... And spread out. We look like a cadet review. ... Spock -- The group spreads out self consciously, as Spock follows Kirk across the street. In mid-street, a car SQUEALS to a stop to avoid hitting Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch were you're going, you dumb ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered) And double dumb ass on you! Spock reacts to this language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the crew having spread out per Kirk's instructions, are waiting as A YOUNG JAPANESE BOY passes Sulu, does a double take and comes up to him. The scene will be played IN JAPANESE with English sub-titles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in wonder) Ojichan? Akira ojichaan dewa naino? Koko de nani shiteru no? (translation) (Uncle Akira?! Is that you? What are you doing here?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in classical Japanese) Gomen nasarei. Hito chigai de gozaranuka na. (translation) I'm sorry, my son. You have mis- taken me for someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, chigaau hito da. Hanashi kata ga okashii. (translation) Yes, this must be true. You talk funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to back away apologetically but Sulu stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chotto omachi nasarei. Namae wa nanto moosareruka na. (translation) Wait my son. What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu Hikaru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (visibly moved) Ah, sorenara mazu mazu nagaiki wo sareru to mira. (translation) Ah... Then I am sure that you will have a long and happy life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arigato. Sayonara. (translation) Thank you, honorable sir. The boy departs and Bones steps to Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, Doctor, was my great great grandfather. On McCoy's reaction we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OWNER examines Kirk's glasses, now shattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they're eighteenth Century American, quite valuable. Are you sure you want to part with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much will you give me? As the Owner examines the glasses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't those a birthday present from Dr. McCoy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they will be again, Spock. That's the beauty of it. (to Owner) How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd be worth more if the lenses were intact. I'll give you 200 bucks take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly) Is that a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kirk divides the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all there is, so nobody splurge. Are we set? (they are) Then, good hunting. And they divide into teams and start off. We stay with Kirk and Spock as they begin walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, Spock, thanks to your restored memory and a little bit of luck, we are in the streets of San Francisco looking for a pair of humpback whales. (then) How do you propose to solve this minor problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple logic will suffice. We need a map. (gestures) That one should do. He leads Kirk to a SYSTEM MAP in a bus stop enclosure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I will juxtapose our coordinates on this map and find our destination. He starts to, but the map is diagrammatic, and very puzzling to Spock. As he struggles with its illogic, a BUS pulls up. On the side is an ad: "See GEORGE AND GRACIE, the only two Humpback Whales in Captivity at the Cetacean Institute, Sausalito." Kirk smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we'll find what we're looking for at the Cetacean Institute in Sausalito. Two Humpbacks called George and  Gracie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed) How do you know this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Simple logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, followed by Spock, enters. The door closes, but the bus does not start. CAMERA PANS along bus to the rear exit door, which opens, disgorging a frustrated Kirk and a puzzled Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean, exact change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, Scotty and Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind telling me how we plan to convert this tank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordinarily, I could do it with a piece of transparent aluminum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about 150 years too early for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. We've got to find the 20th Century equivalent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) What about that? They look off. RACK FOCUS to a billboard: "CAN'T FIND IT? TRY THE YELLOW PAGES!"

dialogues.speaker: PHONE BOOK
dialogues.text: A finger runs down one of the white pages, finds some- thing, snaps the book shut. WIDEN to reveal Chekov emerging from the booth, Uhura waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, under "U.S. Government." Now we need directions. He steps forward, stops a PASSERBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Excuse me, sir. Can you direct me to the Navy base in Alameda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hearing the accent) The... Navy base?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Where they keep the nuclear wessels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock are riding across the Golden Gate Bridge. In front of them, a punker listens to a ghetto blaster so loudly that every time Kirk tries to talk, he can't be heard. Finally he leans forward and shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Can you please stop that sound? In response, the punker flips him the finger. In response to which, Spock gives the punker a Vulcan nerve pinch and disarms the radio. Other passengers applaud. Kirk and Spock settle into their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you observed, a primitive Culture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, may I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, don't call me Admiral. Don't you remember: you used to call me Jim... Now what's your question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your use of language has altered since our arrival. It is currently laced with -- shall I say -- more colorful metaphors: "Double dumb ass on you" -- and so forth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean profanity. That's simply the way they talk here. Nobody pays any attention to you if you don't swear every other word. You'll find it in all the literature of the period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For example? Kirk thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the complete works of Jacqueline Susan, the novels of Harold Robbins....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... The giants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls up and disgorges Kirk, Spock and a few other visitors. They head for the impressive building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large, beautiful, with great hanging replicas of whales dominating. A tour group has gathered, and DR. GILLIAN TAYLOR, perkily attractive , enters to take charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. I'm your guide this morning; my name's Dr. Gillian Taylor, but you can call me Gillian. I'm Assistant Director of the Maritime Cetacean Institute. Please follow me and just give a yell if you can't hear, okay? She starts off, all follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The Cetacean Institute is the only museum in the world exclusively devoted to whales. As you can see we have a great seal to offer, but that is small compared to what we know -- or rather what wee don't know about whales. The first commonly held misconception is that whales are fish. They're not; they're mammals like us. Warm-blooded, needing air to breathe and producing milk to nurse their young. They are very old mammals -- 11 million years, give or take. During the spiel, Taylor notices Kirk. In an odd way, they connect. He's attractive, even in his odd clothes, and he pays stricter attention than the average Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do whales attack people -- like in "Moby Dick"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most whales don't even have teeth. They strain vast amounts of tiny shrimp for food and that is the limit of their hostility. Un- fortunately, their principle enemy is far more aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To put it mildly. Since the dawn of time, men have harvested whales for a variety of purposes, most of which can be achieved synthetically at this point. A hundred years ago, using hand-thrown harpoons, they did plenty of damage -- but that was nothing compared to what they've achieved in this century. Gillian pushes a button and screens modern whale-hunt footage. Pretty gruesome stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; still emotional for her) This is mankind's legacy: whales hunted to the brink of extinction. Virtually gone is the Blue Whale, largest creature ever to inhabit the Earth. (beat) Despite all attempts at banning whaling, there are still countries and pirates currently engaged in slaughter of these inoffensive creatures. Where the humpback whale once numbered in the hundreds of thousands, today there are less than 7 thousand specimens alive and those that are taken are no longer fully grown. In addition, many of the females are killed, still bearing unborn calves. The pictures graphically illustrate what she's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hunt a species to extinction is not logical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter) Whoever said the human race was logical? (then) Now if you'll follow me, I'll introduce you to the Institute's pride and joy. They start after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the largest sea water tank in the world -- and it contains the only two humpback whales in captivity. The two whales undulate majestically. They are colossal. Kirk and Spock react in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) They are mature humpbacks, weighing 45,000 pounds each. They wandered into San Francisco Bay as calves and were brought here. We call them George and Gracie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited whisper) It's perfect, Spock: a male, a female, together in a contained space can beam them up together and consider ourselves damn lucky... Spock reacts oddly to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, aren't they? And extremely intelligent. Why shouldn't they be? They're swimming around with the largest brains on Earth... Now if you'll follow me please. The group enters the building. Spock hangs back. Kirk does not notice his absence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gillian continues the tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite all the things they are teaching us we have to return George and Gracie to the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for one thing, we simply don't have the money to keep feeding them a couple of tons of shrimp a day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon... It's too bad because they're very friendly as you can see. I've grown quite attached to them... This way. She starts down a spiral staircase that winds around the tank. The others follow, minus Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian stops with her back to the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a much better way to see George and Gracie -- underwater. Kirk has begun to look for Spock -- but in vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gillian continues her spiel, CAMERA MOVES IN toward the whales and discovers Spock -- in the water, swimming to them! He approaches one, and looks it in the eye. The great eye stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock and the whale are a foot apart. Spock gently puts his hand on the whale -- a MIND MELD. A shaft of back lightning makes the mood ethereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over speakers, we hear WHALE SONG. The crowd reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're hearing is whale song. It is sung by the male. He'll sing any- where from six to as long as thirty minutes, and then, start again. In the ocean, other whales will pick up the song... And pass it on. Now Kirk sees Spock in the water behind Gillian and is in mild shock. He watches wild-eyed as Spock and whale move through the water in mid mind-meld.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The songs change every year, but we still don't know what purpose they serve. Are they navigational? Part of the mating ritual? Or pure communication beyond our comprehension?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's singing to the man. As the woman points, Gillian turns around to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell --! (starts out) Excuse me! Wait right here! She dashes up the stairs as Kirk desperately pursues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock climbs out, and is putting on his robe as Gillian comes running to him from a distance, followed but Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? What were you doing in there?! Spock turns to Kirk for guidance, but:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the lady! Spock gives it his best logical shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attempting the hell to communicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communicate? Communicate what? You have no right to be here! Spock hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, fellah -- speak up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, if we were to assume these. whales are ours to do with as we please, we would be as guilty as those who caused their extinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes they are together) Ohhhkay. I don't know what this is about, but I want you guys outta here right now or I call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you that won't be necessary. We were only trying to help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you were, buster. Your friend was messing up my tank and messing up my whales...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They like you very much. But they are not the hell your whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose they told you that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell they did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock walking, Golden Gate Bridge in the back- ground . Slight tension between them.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About those colorful metaphors we discussed. I don't think you  should try to use them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for one thing, you haven't quite got the hang of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another thing... It is not  always necessary to tell the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot tell a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to lie... You could exaggerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exaggerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done it before. Can't you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I can't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs; then) What else did you learn from your mind meld?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are very unhappy about the way their species has been treated by man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a right to be...          (then)                              Do you think they'll help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I was successful in  communicating our intentions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an uncertain beat) ... I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian sits on the edge, dangling her feet. George and Gracie swim back and forth next to her, blowing water that showers her. She strokes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. Yes. I know. It's  okay. They didn't mean any harm. The whales make NOISES. They are trying to tell her something -- but what? BOB BRIGGS, Director of the Institute, comes up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard there was some excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a couple of kooks...            Bob watches her affectionately from behind; kicks off his shoes and, rolling up his slacks, sits down next to her with his feet in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me fish stories, kiddo. I've known you too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob... it's tearing me apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I feel the same thing. But we're between a rock and a hard place. We can't keep them without risking their lives and we can't let them go without a taking the same chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dully) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, they're not human beings, you know. Their intelligence has in no way been proven comparable to ours --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about you, but my compassion for someone is not limited to my estimate of their  intelligence. (beat)                                 I mean whales may not have painted     the Mona Lisa or invented the dirt     bike but they didn't ravish the land   either.                                Bob is rebuked. Gillian rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sorry if I spoke out of turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. You gave me things to think about. You always do. You do sound a little wrecked, why don't      you go home and stare at the           ceiling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Why don't I? Gillian goes off. Bob sits, then takes his feet out of the tank. JOE, an assistant, comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all squared away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna go berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for her own good, Joe; it's the only way. She'll call me names for a while, but then she'll calm down and understand.

dialogues.speaker: DAY -
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING             A great AIRCRAFT CARRIER at dock; the Naval Base beyond. As CAMERA MOVES IN, we note from the gangplank banners and the dockside cabanas that this is "U.S.S. ENTERPRISE, CVN65." A definite Star Trek moment.

dialogues.speaker: 103A REVERSE
dialogues.text: (AS SHOT) CAMERA MOVES  to reveal Uhura and Chekov coming through the trees to discover ENTERPRISE in the near distance. A moment between them. Then Uhura whips out her tricorder and begins getting some readings. As the  tricorder BEEPS, Chekov pulls out the communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team leader, this is team 2.   Come in, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the BEEPS increase) I have the coordinates of the                   reactor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It gives me a great sense of                history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gives me a great sense of danger. We have to beam in next to the reactor room, not in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team 2? Kirk here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, we have found the nuclear               wessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, well done, team 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Admiral, it's the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood. What is your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will beam in tonight, collect the  photons and beam out. No one will ever know we were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood and approved. Keep me informed. Kirk out. As Kirk is about to start another call on the comuni- cator, an approaching vehicle makes him put the device  away. He turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock trudging down the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reacts, keeps her eyes on them, and passes them slowly enough so that they look up to see her. As she leaves them behind, she purses her lips, stops the car, considers. Then she backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her -- from the Institute. If  we play our cards right, we may learn when those whales are really leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will playing cards help? The Land rover backs into the scene; Kirk acknowledges her presence but continues walking, playing it cool. Gillian begins tracking alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn't Robin Hood and Friar Tuck. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where're you fellahs heading? Kirk eyes her, keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Came all the way down here to jump in and swim with the kiddies, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's really very little point in my trying to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I buy that. What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's harmless. (inspiration) Back in the sixties he was part of  the Free Speech movement at Berkeley. I think he did too much

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LDS?? Are you dyslexic on top of everything else? Come on, Lemme give you a lift. I have a notorious weakness for hard luck cases -- that's why I work with whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want to be any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already been that. C'mon. She stops, pushes open the door. They get in, Spock in the middle staring straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention it. And don't try anything, either. I got a tire iron right where I can get at it. Kirk has no idea what she's talking about. Silence. Then, to Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So you were at Berkeley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was not. Kirk rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Memory problems, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. What about you? Where  you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iowa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A landlubber. Come on, what the hell were you boys really trying to do back there? Was it some kinda  macho thing? If that's all, I'm gonna be real disappointed. I hate that macho type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen when you release the whales? Long pause. Gillian doesn't like considering this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna hafta take their chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean, exactly? Take their chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means that they will be at risk from whale hunters -- same as the rest of the humpbacks. (to Spock) What did you mean when you said all that stuff back at the Institute about extinction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He meant what you were saying on the  tour: that if things keep on the way they're going, humpbacks will disappear forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what he said, farm boy. "Admiral, if we were to assume these whales are ours to do with as we please, we would be as guilty as those who caused -- past tense -- their extinction." (pause) I have a photographic memory. I see words. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk) Are you sure it isn't time for a colorful metaphor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not one of those guys from the military, are you? Trying to teach whales to retrieve torpedoes,  or some dipshit stuff like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
