dialogues.text: No, ma'am. No dipshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's something. I'da let you off right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Gracie is pregnant. Gillian stops the car with a SQUEAL OF BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Who are you? and don't jerk me around any more. I want to know how you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't tell you. (she starts to interrupt) Please, just -- let me finish. I can tell you that we're not in the military and that we intend no harm to the whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, we may be able to help -- in ways that, frankly, you couldn't possibly imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or believe, I'll bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he sinks back into his seat) Very likely. You're not exactly catching us at our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That much is certain. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I've got a hunch we'd all be a lot happier talking over dinner. What do you say? Gillian considers this for a moment; she's got nothing better to do. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys like Italian food? Kirk and Spock exchange glances, mystified. KIRK      (overlapping)      SPOCK Yes.                          No. She looks at them. What a group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big sign -- PLEXICORP tells us what this place is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, dressed conservatively, paces back and forth. After a moment, the manager, NICHOLS, emerges with Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Scott, I'm Dr. Nichols,  plant manager. I'm terribly sorry but there's been an awful mix-up Would you believe I was never told about your visit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to clear things up,  Professor Scott. I explained you'd come all the way from Edinburgh on appointment to study manufacturing methods here at Plexico, but they don't seem to know anything about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Don't know anything about it? I  find it difficult to believe that I've come millions of miles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands; the Professor's understandably upset --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not missing a beat) Thousands of miles on an invited tour of inspection, only to be informed that I was never invited in the first place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Scott, if you'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand to see the owners! I  demand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, just take it easy! Dr. Nichols is offering to take us around personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chagrined) He is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll follow me, Professor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. Can my assistant come, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Scotty starts past Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bury yourself in the part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu moves through the grounds where Plexiglass Products of all shapes and sizes are stacked. In the midst of this, sits a great HUEY helicopter with the company logo on its side. Its PILOT is working on his engine as Sulu comes up touches the craft lovingly, stares studiously into the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Huey 205, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on. You fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here and there. (pats it) I flew something similar in my Academy days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then this is old stuff to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old, yes. But interesting. (then) Do you mind if I ask a few questions...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impressive glass-walled cubicle separating the boss from the factory chaos. Nichols leads Scotty and Bones inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so much for the tour of our humble plant. I must say, Professor your knowledge of  engineering is most impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back home, we call him the miracle worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed... May I offer you gentlemen anything? A look between Bones and Scotty. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Nichols, I might have something to offer you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I notice you're still working with polymers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mystified) Sill? What else would I be working with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, what else indeed? Let me put it another way: how thick would a piece of your plexiglass need to be at 60 feet by 10 feet to withstand the pressure of 18,000 cubic feet of  water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's easy: 6 inches. We carry stuff that big in stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I noticed. Now suppose -- just suppose -- I could show you a way to manufacture a wall that would do the same job but was only an inch thick. would that be worth something to you, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Are you joking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never jokes... Perhaps the professor could use your computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... He gestures, and Scotty sits at a nearby Macintosh. He surveys the machine quizzically, clears his throat, and in a loud voice says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer -- Bones steps in quickly, picks up the "Mouse" and shoves  it into Scotty's hand. Scotty looks at the mouse, baffled, then puts it to his lips like a mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hello? Computer...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) Just use the keyboard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keyboard... How quaint. Then, preparing his fingers like a concert pianist, he plunges to work furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awesome series of figures and graphics are appearing. PULL BACK to reveal Scotty, now master of the keyboard, while Nichols watches in awe, next to Bones. with a flourish, Scotty hits a last command, and a wondrous three dimensional graphic appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed) Transparent aluminum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the ticket, laddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But it would take years just to figure out the dynamics of this matrix...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be rich beyond the dreams of avarice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, is it worth something? Or should I just punch "clear"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (then) No... What did you have in mind...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment alone, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You know, if we give him the  formula, we'll be altering the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? how do you know he didn't invent the thing! As Bones accepts the truth of this, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Land rover pulls to a stop. Kirk and Spock get out, but Kirk gets back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock is now outside. Gillian calls to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you won't change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something wrong with the one I have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Just a little joke. See you later,  old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still to Spock) How did you know Gracie's pregnant? Nobody knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie does. (to Kirk) I'll be right here. Spock walks OUT OF VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just going to hang around the bushes while we eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) It's his way. And they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: After the Land rover has departed, he is left alone, standing quietly. Then, with no warning, he BEAMS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not fancy but nice; a WAITER stands, ready to take their order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Implicitly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (to Waiter) A large mushroom and pepperoni with extra onions. And a Michelob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, sir? Kirk stares at the menu blankly. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it two. The Waiter leaves. Kirk and Gillian, a moment; then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So how did a nice girl like you get to be a cetacean biologist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unhappily) Just lucky, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're upset about losing the whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You're very perceptive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will that be done, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be flown in a special 747 to Alaska and released there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flown... And that's the last you'll see of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, yes. But we'll tag them with radio transmitters on a special frequency so we can keep tabs on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I could take those whales somewhere they wouldn't be hunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles despite herself) You? You can't even get from Sausalito to San Francisco without a  lift. The Waiter returns with their beers, and two plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Thanks. Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have such a low opinion of my abilities, how come we're having dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you: I'm a sucker for hard luck cases. Besides, I want to know why you travel around with that ditzy guy who knows that Gracie is pregnant and calls you Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk says nothing, looks at her. There's chemistry, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; finally) Where could you take them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My whales? Where could you take them where they'd be safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) It's not so much a matter of a place  as of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, the time would have to be right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly, into her beer) Let's just say that no humpback born in captivity has ever survived. (a sigh) Problem is, they won't be a whole lot safer at sea because of all the hunting this time of year... So that, as they say, is that. (her eyes begin to moisten) Damn. As she dabs her eyes with a napkin, Kirk's communicator  BEEPS three times from under his clothes. Pained, he ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a pocket pager? What are you, a doctor? The BEEPER again. Exasperated, Kirk flips it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) What is it? I thought I told you never to call me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Admiral. We just thought you'll like to know, we're beaming them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I see -- (Sotto) Tell Them phasers on stun. Good luck. Kirk out. Long pause. Gillian stares at him, pulls on her beer thoughtfully. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna try it from the top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me when the whales are going to  be released?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think I am? She bites her pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me: you're from outer space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm from Iowa. I just work in outer space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was close. I knew outer space was going to come into it sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. The truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you think.   (then) Okay...Truth... I'm from what, on   your calendar, would be the late 23rd Century. I've been sent back in time to bring two Humpback Whales with me in an attempt to...  repopulate the species.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why didn't you say so? Why all the coy disguises?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the details?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I wouldn't miss this for all the tea in China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me when the whales are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you are persistent. (then) Okay, your friend was right. Gracie is not only pregnant, she is very pregnant... At noon tomorrow -- in what is sure to be a media circus -- the whales get shipped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Noon tomorrow...?! The Waiter arrives, plunks the pizza down and holds up the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gets the bad news...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't' tell me: they don't have money in the 23rd Century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we don't. (then, rising) Come on. I don't have much time now. And so saying, he exits, leaving a baffled Gillian and  Waiter. Gillian, a beat, then covers to the Waiter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Could we have this to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S.S enterprise, floodlit, secure. Shore Patrolmen on duty. A general sense of tight security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SAILOR in dungarees and a DRUG DOG patrol the empty corridor. As they near CAMERA a familiar SOUND (THE BEAM-IN) is heard faintly. The dog stops, his ears go up in surprise. The sailor has not heard the sound. He whistles to the dog and urges him on down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep within the bowels of the ship. Uhura and Chekov have made it in. They carry with them the COLLECTING DEVICE, a long, flashlight-like tube with a folded up metal piece. They start forward, hide momentarily as a  PAIR OF FEET walk above them, seen through the metal decking which forms a ceiling above them. Then they start carefully OUT OF SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signs of danger and warnings. Definitely off limits. They move quickly to the "Reactor threshold," a control area marked by sings, warnings, and flashing red lights. Uhura takes a confirming reading on her tricorder, nods, and Chekov fans the metal piece open into a parabolic shape. He places the "dish" in the  place indicated by Uhura, turns on a power source. A FAINT SOUND indicates it is working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on how much shielding is between us and the reactor. She looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Land rover pulls to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she pulls on the handbrake. The empty pizza box is between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, "Admiral," that may be the  strangest dinner of my life and the biggest cockamamie fish story I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked. (then) Now, will you tell me something? (at her look) George and Gracie's transmitter. What's the frequency? She looks at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Sorry, that's classified. (beat) I don't really have a clue who you are... You wouldn't want to show me around your space ship, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be my first choice, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. There we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme tell you something. I'm here to bring two humpbacks into the 23rd  Century. If I have to, I'll go to the open sea to get them, but I'd just as soon take yours -- better for me, better for you... and better for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're a damn good poker player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it -- but don't take too long because I'm out of time. If  you change your mind, this is where I'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around) Here... In the park?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. He gives her a brief kiss and is gone. She sits there, surprised, but not disagreeably. Then she RESTARTS her CAR and is about to depart when she hears an ODD SOUND O.S. and there is a SLIGHT FLICKER of reflected LIGHT. She turns and looks back through the rear window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one within a hundred feet of where Kirk last stood.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO GILLIAN
dialogues.text: She turns back, puzzled; slips the car into gear, and still puzzled, departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk materializes and is met by Spock. Immediately they begin walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tank will be finished by morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cutting it closer than you know. What about team two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No word since beam-in. We can only wait for their call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.... Damnit! We've been so lucky. We have the two perfect whales in our hands, but if we don't move quickly, we'll lose them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that event, the probabilities are that our mission would fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Our mission! Goddam it, Spock, you're talking about the end of every life on Earth! You're half human, haven't you got any goddamned feelings about that!! Enraged and frustrated, Kirk stalks off, leaving Spock. A critical moment: his feelings are surfacing: anger, pain, and above all, confusion.

dialogues.speaker: "COLLECTOR"
dialogues.text: PULL BACK. The device is still HUMMING. Uhura looks at Chekov in concern. He can only shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which seems to be having electronic trouble. Watching it are a RADAR OPERATOR and an ELECTRONIC TECHNICIAN. in b.g. are other ENLISTED TECHS, and TWO OFFICERS. The Operator plays with the faulty screen and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell... There it is again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's weird. (turns) Commander... The COMMAND DUTY OFFICER steps to the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were running a test program...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir, but we're getting an apparent power drain through the  module. It's coming from somewhere in the ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.I.C., Command Duty Officer Rogerson. (listens) Yes, Chief, we're tracking it here, too. What do you make of it? (he tightens) You sure?... Check the Video scan, I  need a confirm. (cups phone; to the others) He thinks there's an intruder in one of the MMR's.

dialogues.speaker: 131B UHURA AND CHEKOV
dialogues.text: The Collector makes a sound that appears final. As Chekov removes the device from the bulkhead and folds the metal in place, Uhura flips the communicator open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty: we're ready for beam out. (a pause; static) Scotty... Can you hear me...?

dialogues.speaker: 131C THE C.I.C. ROOM
dialogues.text: As the C.D.O., waiting on phone hears a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Chief?... Confirmed, Roger that. He clicks off, dials a number code and in a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; urgent now) Mardet C.O. this is Commander Rodgerson, the Command Duty Officer. We have and intruder in the #4 M.M.R. I say again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty... Come in please... Do you read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking up) Aye, lass, I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... My transporter power's down to minimal. I got to bring you in one  at a time. Stand by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the collector. You go first! Chekov steps aside, as Scotty sweats back in the B.O.P. Transporter. The Transporter power is discernibly weak. At last, Uhura is slowly BEAMED OUT. Chekov,  looks nervously about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty... How soon... Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty is working feverishly as Chekov's voice breaks up on speaker. During scene Uhura enters and listens anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov, you're breaking up. Please     signal again. Chekov, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUNNING FEET, an O.S. COMMOTION, are louder, closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty... Now would be a good time --

dialogues.speaker: PAST CHEKOV, (AS SHOT)
dialogues.text: From all angles, U.S. MARINES in jungle fatigues, helmets and bandoliers have surrounded Chekov, their SHOTGUNS leveled at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! There is a pause as Chekov stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely what does this mean -- "freeze?"

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 138

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AS SHOT) We are CLOSE on an FBI AGENT, his badge in lapel pocket. He's examining Chekov's I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Commander Pavel Chekov, Starfleet, United Federation of Planets. PULL BACK to include Chekov, various NAVAL OFFICERS, and a CIVILIAN, (A.E.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) All right, Commander, you wanna tell us anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like who you really are and what you're doing here and what this thing is. The phaser -- on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Pavel Chekov. I am a Lt. Commander in Starfleet, United Federation of Planets, service number 656-5827b.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's take it from the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play games with me and you're through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am? May I go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent takes a deep breath of exasperation and, leaving Chekov at the table, walks back to the Civilian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Russkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding... He may be a russkie,  all right, but he's a retard or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better call Washington... While they huddle, Chekov snatches up the phaser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. They stare at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Make nice and give us the ray gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I varn you. If you don't lie on the floor, I vill have to stun you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patiently) Go ahead. Stun me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wery sorry, but -- He aims the phaser and pulls. It makes a pathetic BURBLING SOUND. Everyone stares. Chekov,  apologetically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It must be the radiation... With an abrupt change of mood he bolts for the nearest bulkhead door, dogs it open and reaches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) Someone sound a general alarm. better tell the Marines to go easy, don't hurt the crazy bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OF SHOTS A140  -- As ALARMS SOUND, Chekov dogs a bulkhead door beh him, then as a choice of down a hatch or up a ladder.  He wisely goes up. B140  -- Marines pour from hatchways and corridors in hot pursuit. C140  -- Chekov up a ladder, Marines in pursuit below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Up the ladders come the Marines. D140  -- HANGAR DECK: Chekov breaks into the great empty space, barn like; he see's the elevator opening and a shot at freedom, he races toward the light. E140  -- Marines, gaining, follow him across the hangar d F140  -- Chekov reaches the elevator portal, races onto t elevator and the gangway beyond -- only to see: G140  -- SHORE PATROLMEN, coming up the gangplank to the elevator. H140  -- Behind Chekov, the Marines have caught up. He ve to his left, thinking to dive into the water, trips and, with a cry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for Chekov. He falls from the elevator into CAMERA --

dialogues.speaker: 140B REVERSE
dialogues.text: Chekov has landed on a floating barge below  the elevator. He lies there, unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marines and Shore patrolmen look in horror. The FBI MAN rushes up, and seeing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... Get an ambulance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's at her station, distraught, monitoring a series of local POLICE and PARAMEDICAL EMERGENCY CALLS. Kirk enters, comes to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... I should never have left him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, you did what was necessary. (gently) Keep trying. You'll find him... Kirk steps to his chair, presses COMM, weary,  frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, you promised me an estimate on the dilithium crystals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty and Spock are watching a slow re-crystallization process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going slow, sir. It'll be well into tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough, Scotty. You've   got to do better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) I'll try, sir. Scott out. (then, to Spock) Well now, he's got himself in a bit of a snit, don't he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) ... He is a man of deep feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So what else is new... HOLD on Spock. Up above, HOLD on Kirk, as Uhura's  police calls ECHO faintly in b.g., he feels all the frustration of waiting... DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Land rover pulls up and Gillian gets out, puzzled. It's very quiet. No press. No crews. The main door is locked. She takes out a key, and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian enters, and stares: It's strange, ghostly, and empty here. She can see no sign of George or Gracie. Has her world gone mad? Has she walked into the wrong dimension? As her distress mounts she turns to face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) They left last night. (then) We didn't want a mob scene with the press, it wouldn't have been good for them. Besides -- we thought it  would be easier on you this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rage rising) You -- sent them away. Without even letting me say goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian -- She slaps him hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gillian runs to her car from b.g. and climbs in, close. For a moment she just sits there, her head on the wheel, sobbing now. Then with determination, she starts the car, and peels out of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plexicorp helicopter, carrying an enormous pane of plexiglass across the city. It is not exactly steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu is at the controls, muttering to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How the hell did they ever keep these things in the air...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAY As the chopper and its load pass overhead;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Land rover drives up and stops. Gillian jumps out,  still overwrought. She looks around and almost like a   silent scream for help, she yells Kirk's name. The scream is silent because its drowned out by the SOUND OF  THE APPROACHING HELICOPTER. Gillian looks up to see:

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: It comes closer, then hovers.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: He climbs into SHOT from below FRAME LINE, waves Sulu in like a landing officer on a carrier.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAN
dialogues.text: She cannot believe what she's seeing O.S.

dialogues.speaker: ILM
dialogues.text: The chopper is lowering the plexiglass into thin air, and guiding the process is half of Scotty, visible only from the waist up.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Gillian, stunned, moves forward to get a better view, and clunks her head on an invisible strut. She gets up and feels the thing like a blind person. She's starting to understand she's in some Twilight Zone. In desperation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk! Kirk! Listen to me! Oh, God, Kirk, I need you!!

dialogues.speaker: TO SCOTTY
dialogues.text: He's seen her distress below him. To communicator:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, we have  problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is looking upward, a shaft of daylight falling on his face. As he hears Scotty's cry from above, he turns quickly to a SURVEILLANCE MONITOR close by. There on the screen he sees Gillian's agitated figure. There is a moment of amazed reaction then looking back up to Scotty:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by, Scotty!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As, hysterically, she trips and bumps into other parts of the invisible ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk!! Please, Kirk!! The SOUND she once heard, she hears again; and to her disbelief, she disappears in the BEAM EFFECT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gillian BEAMS IN. Kirk is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Alice. Welcome to wonderland. She looks about, dazed as he helps her off transporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true... what you said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... And I'm glad you're here. Though I'll admit, you picked a hellova time to drop in... She's about to faint; Kirk catches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Steady, now. We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I flipped out? ... Is any of this real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all real. Look. (takes her) The storage tanks for the whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Kirk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll bring them up just like we brought you. It's called a transporter beam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing now) Kirk. They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Gone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were taken last night. I wasn't told. They're in Alaska by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're tagged, I told you. Can't you go find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the moment, we can't go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of spaceship is this, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spaceship with a missing man. He looks up to see Spock entering, all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral. Full power is restored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Spock. As Gillian stares at Spock's ears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Doctor. Welcome aboard. He offers his hand. She shakes it in wonder as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionally) Admiral -- are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Uhura -- what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) I've found Chekov, sir: he's in emergency surgery right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura!... Where!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's in the Mission District.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They report his condition as critical; he is not expected to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, you've got to let me go in there! Don't leave him in the hands of Twentieth Century medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already decided, but:) What do you think, Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, may I suggest that Dr. McCoy is correct. We must help Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testing) Is that the logical thing to do, Spock...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Admiral... But is the human thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a beat) Right. (to Gillian) Will you help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need to look like physicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK with Kirk, Bones and Gillian -- dressed as DOCTORS AND NURSES. Bones carries his own medical equipment in a traditional black bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll check this way; you try down there... They split; Kirk and Gillian go one way. We follow Bones. He walks down a corridor, nodding to other doctors, nurses, interns. He sees a gurney, steps to it. On it is a very feeble ELDERLY WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint) Kidney... dialysis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dialysis?? What is this, the dark ages? Here, swallow one of these. He slips a lozenge from his bag under her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Call me if you have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Gillian. Kirk gestures, O.S. WIDEN to admit Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're holding him in a security corridor one flight up. His condition is critical. Bones reacts, then looks around. He sees an empty gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Bones, masks on their faces, emerge wheeling the gurney with Gillian under the covers. They head for an elevator. The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Bones push the gurney in. TWO INTERNS are talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Weintraub says radical chemotherapy or she's gonna croak. Just like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Gottlieb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what'd you expect? All he talked about was image therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a different view, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like the goddam Spanish Inquisition... The doors open. They wheel the bed out, the doors close, leaving the Interns looking at each other, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK behind Kirk, Bones and the bed towards the end of the hall. TWO POLICEMEN block their passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the way! They don't budge. Under the sheet, Gillian starts to wail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, doctor! we have strict orders... Gillian wails louder. The Policemen look uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, this woman has immediate post prandial upper abdominal distension! Do you want an acute case on your hands? Gillian wails. The Policemen finally move aside and they push their way through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say she was getting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cramps. Gillian sits up, throws off the sheet as they see the operating theatre. They leave the bed where it is and proceed into the room, lifting their surgical masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, why hasn't this man been prepped? Kirk looks to Bones, who nods and they walk around the curtain where Chekov, unconscious, lies on the table. Two nurses arrange instruments in preparation for surgery, while a YOUNG DOCTOR reads Chekov's chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) Who are you? Doctor Adams was supposed to assist me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just -- observing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was not informed about observers. Then, to the curious glances of the surgical team, Bones takes out his Tricorder and passes it over to Chekov --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)  What the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading the patient's vital signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An experimental device, doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tearing of the middle meningeal artery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your degree in, dentistry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you explain slowing pulse, low respiratory rate and coma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fundoscopic examination --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fundoscopic examination is unrevealing in these cases!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (condescendingly) A simple evacuation of the expanding epidural hematoma will relieve the  pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, man, drilling holes in his head is not the answer. The artery must be repaired without delay or he will die! So put away your butcher knives and let me save the patient! The young Doctor gives Bones an icy stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who the hell you are, but I'm going to have you removed. But as he turns to leave, Kirk blocks his path, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctors, doctors, this is highly unprofessional -- He gives the Doctor a swift, sure, Judo chop. Gillian and the nurses gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Quite harmless, I assure you. As Bones pulls out his Medical Tricorder and begins working on Chekov, Kirk slings the fallen Doctor over his shoulder, and draws a phaser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Nurses) Ladies. Please... Indicating a windowed room adjoining, he herds them in there, lowers the Doctor to the floor, and closes the door. Then he adjusts his phaser, aims at the lock and:

dialogues.speaker: ILM
dialogues.text: Kirks phaser MELTS the lock.

dialogues.speaker: 167B BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bones, muttering as he passes the device over Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemotherapy... fundoscopic examination... dealing with medievalism here! Kirk joins him; Chekov has begun to moan faintly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Wake up, man, wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Pavel... Chekov's eyes begin to flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming 'round, Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pavel, can you hear me? Give me your name and rank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Chekov... Pavel H... Rank - (a fantasy smile) ... Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you guys have any enlisted types...? Now Chekov is pulling out of it. He sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr McCoy... ZDRASTVUYTE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello to you, Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Doctors," pushing the sheet-draped Chekov, exit, passing the two Policemen we saw before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the patient...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exiting) He's gonna make it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He? They went in with a she... They look at each other, make a beeline for the O.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters) One little mistake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crystals are coming back to life! WIDEN to reveal the process supervised by Scotty, watched by Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling the gurney in a hurry. ALARMS go off! LOUDSPEAKERS! They break into a run.

dialogues.speaker: 170A SAME CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: A group of HOSPITAL and POLICE GUARDS round a corner, see the fleeing Kirk, and race toward us, CAMERA PANNING. As they exit, HOLD on double doors which open. Sitting up on an emergency gurney, happy as a clam, is the feeble old lady we saw before. Two DOCTORS, one pushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So! How do you explain it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) According to the scanner... (beat) ... She's grown a new kidney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kirk and friends, racing at high speed... -- The guards, weapons drawn are gaining... -- On the speeding Gurney, Chekov raises his head in confusion; Bones clunks him down. -- A large elevator door opens ahead; as the gurney heads for it, a hospital GUARD steps in the way; using the gurney as a battering ram, Kirk takes the Guard out of the play, races with Bones and Gillian into the  elevator. The doors close just as the perusing forces get there. The guards check the "UP" indicator and head for the stairs! -- Inside the elevator, going up. Gillian is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we keep going up, they'll catch us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm yourself, Nurse. (pulls out communicator) Scotty, get us out of here! -- TOP FLOOR: The pursuers race out of the Stairwell, across the Elevator, where the indicator says they've beat the elevator. Weapons drawn, they wait: when the doors open and they press forward: -- POV: The Elevator is empty. -- Back to the group: Consternation.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 178

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kirk, Gillian, Bones and Chekov BEAM IN. Bones leads Chekov toward -- -- The descending RAMP. Sulu appears to help. They all disappear up the ramp, which now begins to close. -- Kirk alone with Gillian. She sees the ramp closing and begins to sense something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gillian... Would the whales be at sea by now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... If you have a chart on board, I can show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need is the radio frequency to track them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't. Our next stop is the 23rd Century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I care? I've got nobody but those whales...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no time to argue, Gillian. Or even tell you how much you've meant to us... The frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. The frequency is 401 megahertz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. For everything. (flips communicator) Beam me up, Scotty. As Kirk starts to BEAM UP, Gillian leaps, grabs him round the waist. And as they are BEAMED IN together:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH, and Kirk strides in angry, Gillian following, looking around room at all the crew in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock, where the hell is the power you promised me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, you must wait one damn minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready Spock. Let's go find George and Gracie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (punching buttons) I'm trying to remember how this works. I got used to a Huey. As he works, Kirk turns to Gillian:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tricked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Mr. Sulu. And the GREAT ROAR BEGINS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a GREAT HURRICANE envelopes the meadow along with the ROAR. Trees bend, trash cans and panic tables tumble until the roar begins to recede -

dialogues.speaker: PULLING UP -
dialogues.text: DAY The landing area below is receding rapidly as the Bird's rockets ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the professionals from the future crackle their routine, Gillian watches, wide eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cloaking device is stable... All systems normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stabilize Energy Reserve!... Report helm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintaining impulse climb. Wing five by zero, helm steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advise reaching 10,000. Steer three-one-zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-one-zero, aye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, scan for the whales. 401 megahertz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanning, sir!

dialogues.speaker: STILL RISING -
dialogues.text: By now we see the outline of the bay and bridges on a sun sprayed beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10,000 M.S.L., Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wing to cruise configuration... Full impulse power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir... Three-one-zero to the Bering Sea. E.T.A.: 12 minutes. As Gillian reacts to this, the impulse engines ROAR and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are speeding at Mach 16 or 17 down the California coast and out toward the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty: Are the whale tanks secure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye. But I've never beamed up 400 tons before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 400 Tons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't just the whales, it's the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Kirk moves to Uhura, followed by Gillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whales... Any contact? Uhura, earpiece pressed, holds up her hand to indicate she is working on it.

dialogues.speaker: 188C FAVORING SPOCK'S STATION
dialogues.text: As Spock looks baffled, Bones ENTERS SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, ah... (diplomatically) You present the appearance of a man with a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your perception is correct, Doctor... In order to return us to the exact moment at which we left the 23rd Century, I have used our journey back through time as a referent, calculating the coefficient of elapsed time in relation to the acceleration curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally. (then) So what is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acceleration is no longer a constant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're gonna have to take your best shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Best shot...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess, Spock. Your best guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Guessing" is not in my nature...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has waited 10 years for this) Well nobody's perfect...

dialogues.speaker: UHURAH'S STATION
dialogues.text: FAINT SOUND of Whale Transponder is heard. Gillian reacts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative. Contact with the whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearing 327, range 600 nautical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them on screen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you do that?! It's radio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Image translation on screen! On VIEWSCREEN, a slightly deteriorated image, but we can make out George and Gracie. There is a moment of reaction from Gillian, Kirk, Spock and all. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They breech, singing their song, and the music swells to say what is in everyone's heart: hang in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, I have a signal closing on the whales. Bearing 328 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen. ON VIEWSCREEN: A semi-clear image of a whaling ship, its prow cutting through the water, its harpoon gun very much in evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of ship is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whaling ship, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimate range, ship to whales!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... Estimating one nautical mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, we're too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu: full power descent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horizon rises as our view dips 20 degrees, the speed increases to 12,000 MPH, and we whiz through puffy clouds toward an unseen ocean target hundreds of  miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (35MM STOCK) The Whaler is modern, and plows through the water at 25 knots. Its crew are largely bearded; they are Northern Europeans, maybe Swedes, Icelanders or Russians, all famous as Humpback hunters. The radar turns lazily. Then: In the crow's nest a sailor points. Binoculars are trained. They see something! The ship begins a gradual course change. The engine telegraph signals FLANK SPEED. The decks are exploding with activity as she heads toward the quarry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whales break the surface, arcing majestically; enjoying the sun and their freedom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NOTE: We may now utilize, on VIEWSCREEN, scenes of WHALES and WHALING SHIP, as well as POV's of the Bird's forward view, which at the moment, is on screen.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dive speed is 200 knots per minute, 3.3. per second. Estimate reaching whales in 1.2 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Feverish activity, punctuated by the rising SOUND OF SONAR PINGING. Harpoons are being carried to the gun and loaded. The crew begins pointing excitedly to the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Gracie, oblivious to the danger, move through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range to whales, 30 seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The harpoon gun is loaded and is transversing.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 204

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the boat on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 seconds, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hover on my mark, Mr. Sulu! Mr. Chekov, stand by de-cloaking -- Scotty, ready for power build up! (then) Mark, Mr. Sulu...

dialogues.speaker: THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: They lazily appear on the surface, oblivious to danger. They are a perfect target.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP
dialogues.text: The gunner sights with confidence -- fires!

dialogues.speaker: FX SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: The harpoon sails through the air toward the whales, then, with a great THWANG, hits an invisible something, and falls harmlessly into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Bafflement! Consternation! Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty -- Disengage cloaking device!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the harpoon had stopped, now comes a ROAR OF SOUND and LIGHT. The Bird of Prey, big as a football field, DE-CLOAKS!

dialogues.speaker: ABOARD THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Oh-my-God! What-he-hell! ALARM KLAXONS! The helmsman spins the wheel! The engine telegraph goes to flank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defeat of the whaler causes the cheers of all. But Kirk quiets them with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott. It's up to you now. Commence build up for transporter beam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it me best, sir! As the SOUND of the beam build-up begins:

dialogues.speaker: CARGO BAY
dialogues.text: Everything is to the firewall and he's sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with me, sir -- I need more power curve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long, Scotty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 seconds, Admiral; 5 - 4 - 3 -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the energy WHINE PEAKS:

dialogues.speaker: ILM ELEMENTS
dialogues.text: George and Gracie, moving slowly through the deep, begin to BEAM OUT...

dialogues.speaker: CARGO BAY
dialogues.text: As Scotty watches in awe, the whales, and half a tank of sea water, BEAM IN. On Scotty, open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral! There be whales here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Mr. Scott. How soon can we be ready for warp speed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to re-energize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take too long. We're sitting ducks for their radar systems... (then) Mr. Sulu, impulse climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she begins to climb with moderate speed to altitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unidentified aircraft, 40,000 feet MSL, range 30 miles, bearing 010.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott -- how soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by, sir. Miracle worker at work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, don't make jokes, we are  in danger of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full power, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovers from his pique and.) Mr. Sulu, if you please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir, warp speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey EXPLODES into warp speed, disappearing into the deep blue-black of Space beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, take the con. I'm taking our guest down to see her whales. (as he starts) Mr. Spock: have you accounted for the variable mass of whales and water in your time re-entry program?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott cannot give me exact figures, Admiral. So I will... (a beat) Make a guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?   (laughs) Spock, that's extraordinary. He steps forward, shakes Spock's hand as though he had just come through a great transformation. In high spirits, Kirk leads Gillian off the bridge, leaving a puzzled Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't think he understands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Spock. It means he feels safer about your "guesses" than most other peoples facts. There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying... It is a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. Spock straightens, pulls the bottom of his garment straight with dignity, and accepts the responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will try to make the best guess I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two whales are contentedly behind the plexiglass, their eyes focusing on Gillian. Kirk, Scotty flank her, all watching the whales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ironic. When man was killing these creatures, he was destroying his own future...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gillian) The beasties seem happy to see you, Doctor. I hope you like our little aquarium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A miracle, Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The miracle is yet to come. Scotty exits shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means our chances of getting home are not very good. You might have lived a longer life if you'd stayed where you belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I belong here. (at his look) Suppose by some miracle you do get them through. (beat) Who in the 23rd Century knows anything about Humpback whales?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long moment) ... You have a point... As she looks at Kirk, the ship begins to vibrate quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get up there, sir. We're having some power fall-off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way...! Kirk hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buckle up, Lassie. It gets bumpy from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before she's heading straight for the great Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk enters through the WHOOSHING DOORS. The bridge is beginning to shake badly now. Kirk listens to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp seven point five... Seven point nine... Mr. Sulu, that's all I can give ye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields at Maximum! Kirk steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we make breakaway speed!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly, Admiral, I cannot even guarantee we will escape the Sun's gravity! I will attempt to compensate by altering our trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp eight. Eight point one... Maximum speed, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, I need thruster control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acceleration thrusters at Spock's command...! CLOSE on Spock as the buffeting gets intense. A wait. A further wait. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady... Steady... Now.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: -- Just as the Bird appears certain to be swallowed by the Sun, a BLAST accelerates the ship along the far curve of the Sun as before. Solar flares lick the blurring vessel as she disappears behind the Sun. The CAMERA PANS ACROSS the Sun, waiting for the "comet" to appear around the far side of the Sun as she did before... And we wait. And we wait. -- CLOSER. The bird does not appear. The wait is interminable. Has the ship incinerated...? Then abruptly: there is a BANG and the SOUND OF RETROS as we heard in the first time sequence. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SILENCE is total and deafening. We do not hear even the ambient pings and pongs of the electronic equipment. We have a feeling of LIMBO. Yet the people seem all right, though baffled. Are we in some new dimension? Kirk surveys the scene, and dares to speak:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock... Did braking thrusters fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... Where the hell are we? Consternation from all; then, FAINTLY in the void of sound, we begin to hear the PROBE GIBBERISH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAVES CRASH against the shore. This sequence is exactly as we saw earlier in the film. GIBBERISH louder now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before; Panic; Lightning and PROBE GIBBERISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... I'm picking up a faint transmission... It's Admiral Kirk calling...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen! But at this moment, the entire situation display goes fuzzy, distorts, and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Satellite reserve power, now! The board starts up again, but dimmer, more erratic. A distorted image of Kirk appears on SCREEN (INTERCUT WITH BIRD OF PREY). We will not hear every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Analysis... Probe call... Captain Spock... Opinion... extinct species, Humpback Whale... proper response... Do you read me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stabilize! Emergency reserve! As the Comm Officer responds, Sarek steps up beside Morrow. Now Kirk's image clears enough to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet, if you read, we are going to attempt time travel. We are computing our trajectory at this time... But suddenly the power fails, Kirk's image is gone. A silence as they stare at the blank screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Good luck, Kirk. And all you go with you. The interruption is sudden: the entire great window facing the bay CRASHES INWARD, filling the room with debris, cries, and howling wind. (END REPEAT SEQUENCE.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the wind and the rain blow through the room, we find Sarek and Morrow, hands held up to protect their faces, then, suddenly, Sarek looks outward -- point"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: BIRD OF PREY
dialogues.text: Deep overcast, lightning flashes, heavy rain. We are looking toward the Golden Gate. The BIRD OF PREY is descending out of the overcast headed toward the bridge in a shallow, but uncontrolled dive. PROBE GIBBERISH present through out sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buffeting of turbulence; the GIBBERISH loud. A sense of helplessness we've never seen from this crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock: Condition report!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No data, Admiral. Computers are non-functional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mains are down, sir! Aux power is not responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, switch to manual control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no control, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture, Uhura!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, sir -- Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of control, and blind as a bat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Godsakes, Jim, where are we...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS - ILM -- Where they are is: headed for the Golden Gate Bridge. -- Sarek, Morrow and the others watch in horror as -- -- The Bird narrowly misses by sheer luck and WHOOSHES under the great bridge -- -- Skimming now over the ocean, closer and closer to impact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- I've got some back pressure on manual --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground cushion! Keep the nose up if you can --

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: -- The Bird's long snout rotates up just a bit and: -- The crew holds its breath and -- -- The Bird of Prey SLAMS into the water like a giant stone being skipped, bounces once, then bellies in with ripping  SOUNDS -- -- The crew is thrown about the bridge -- and the side WINDOWS blow out with a POW! -- The Bird comes to rest, nose high. After a moment it is clear she is sinking.

dialogues.speaker: TILTED
dialogues.text: Water sprays from seams and pipes; the crew struggles to move against the uphill tilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow the hatch! Spock does. Kirk struggles to the blown out hatch near Spock. He looks up into the rain above:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain, fog, but above all: the GIBBERISH of the Probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got us to the right place, Spock. Now all we have to do is get the whales out before we sink. (reaches Comm) Mr. Scott, come in!... Scotty...?! (then) Damn... Mr. Spock, see to the safety of all hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Admiral. Stay with Kirk as he fights his way downhill to the exit doors, which he forces open with great effort, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: FLOODED CARGO BAY
dialogues.text: They're in trouble. The water is waist deep and rising. Scotty cannot open the hatch door to the NECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, water spraying about him, reaching the cargo bay door. He tugs at the emergency release. It's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: FLOODED CARGO BAY
dialogues.text: Water is now up to their necks. Scotty and Gillian can't get out unless -- -- Kirk now wrenches the release, pulls the door open. He reaches his hand down, helps Gillian, then Scotty, into the temporary safety of the corridor above. Above the DIN OF WIND, RAIN and HISSING WATER, Kirk shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whales...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No power to the bay doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosive override -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's under water! There's no way to reach it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on ahead... Close the hatch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, you'll be trapped! But Kirk takes a deep breath and is gone, diving below. Scotty watches helplessly, then turns to aid Gillian up and out, closing the hatch as ordered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kirk swims in, begins searching. It's not going to be easy: Kirk cannot hold his breath forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crew, one by one, emerge from the bridge window into the pelting rain. They cling to the floating bridge. Inside the bridge, Spock helps Scotty and Gillian in and to the window exit.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF CARGO BAY
dialogues.text: Kirk breaks the surface, his lungs screaming for air. Only a few inches remain unflooded. He gulps air, and dives one last time.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: A determined Kirk swims rapidly down, looks desperately, finally finds the panel behind a layer of wreckage. He rips the barrier away, opens the seal, presses the sensor. There is a MUFFLED EXPLOSION and:

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF CARGO HOLD
dialogues.text: The bay doors swing open!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KIRK
dialogues.text: He looks up and around for his best way out: deciding he suddenly dives down, disappears and -- -- emerges out the open bay doors. He heads for the surface and --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: -- Kirk pops to the surface gulping for air. The rain pelts him. He looks round. -- The last of the survivors, Gillian and Spock emerge safely. -- Kirk relieved but where are the whales? And the Probe's nagging GIBBERISH is heard again. He dives once more...

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: comes toward us, stops to see:

dialogues.speaker: CARGO BAY DOORS
dialogues.text: George and Gracie emerge from the bay doors, and majes- tically move away from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK, (INTERCUT)
dialogues.text: He watches in wonder; then heads for the surface.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: -- Kirk surfaces near the floating bridge and the sur- vivors. Rain pelts; fog obscures; and above all: the still unanswered CALL of the Probe. -- CLOSER: Kirk arrives at the wreckage, takes a hand hold near Gillian and Spock, looks back in deep concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't they answer? (a beat) Why don't they sing, dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now something few have seen: "George" swims into center stage, undulates, and drops into a hanging ver- tical position. Then he begins: WHALE SONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's antenna turns to the new SOUND. Then, it trans- mits a NEW GIBBERISH, somehow more conversational.

dialogues.speaker: THE WHALE
dialogues.text: As this new dialogue mounts, the Probe will always trans- mit GIBBERISH from above, the whale will always answer with WHALE SONG from underwater. But even the dullest of us will sense the relaxing of concern and tension, the almost conversational climax between the two commu- nicators. And then:

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: It sends what sounds what like a farewell burst of  GIBBERISH; then, a THRUSTER FIRES, and the Probe arcs up and out of orbit into the far distance, leaving Earth behind. As it leaves, the lights in SPACEDOCK slowly begin to wink on.

dialogues.speaker: ILM
dialogues.text: -- The rain begins to stop. -- The swirling clouds begin to calm -- and part. -- A shaft of slim sunlight peeks through. -- Kirk, Spock, Gillian watch. -- The crew watches as the clouds begin to part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the great BOARD becomes reactivated. Lights go on. SOUND and chatter return to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President -- we have power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at window) By God! Launch rescue shuttle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With our floating survivors in f.g., we see the rapidly clearing skies over the Golden Gate Bridge and the city beyond. We hear FAINTLY, approaching RESCUE SHUTTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear the growing SOUND of approaching rescue and looks at the clearing sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Jim. I think you've saved the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me, Bones... They did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Gracie breach and frolic in their new world; the sun breaks fully through, creating a most wonderful rainbow... All in all, a beautiful day in the 23rd century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABRUPT CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somber, hushed by contrast. Galleries filled largely by STARFLEET PERSONNEL. Some coughs. No talk. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SIDE ENTRY DOOR
dialogues.text: It WHOOSHES open and the President and the Council enters soberly and take their places. The President goes to the central podium. He looks into the front row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring in the accused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A somber group in spanking fresh uniforms, enters... They are Kirk, Bones, Scotty, Uhura, Sulu and Chekov. They walk past a front row where Gillian, Chapel, Rand, Sarek and Spock watch them. The audience murmurs as the "Accused" take their place on the Federation Seal. Moment. Then Spock rises and crosses to Kirk's group where he stands at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Spock, you do not stand accused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stand with my shipmates. Their fate shall be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish. (then) The charges and specifications are: Conspiracy; Assault on Federation Officers; Theft of Federation Property; namely the Starship Enterprise; Sabotage of the U.S.S. Excelsior; willful destruction of Federation Property, specifically the aforementioned U.S.S. Enterprise; and finally, disobeying direct orders of the Starfleet Commander... Admiral Kirk, how do you plead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On behalf of all of us, Mr. President, I am authorized to plead guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So entered. Hear now the sentence of the Federation Council: (clears throat) Because of certain mitigating circumstances, all charges but one are summarily dismissed. (a buzz through the crowd) The remaining charge, disobeying orders of a superior officer is directed only at Admiral Kirk. (looks up) I'm sure the Admiral will recognize the necessity of keeping discipline in any chain of command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James T. Kirk. It is the judgment of this Council that you be reduced  in rank to Captain. (uncertain buzz) ... And that as a consequence of your new rank, you be given the duties for which you have repeatedly demonstrated unswerving ability: the command of a Starship. Reactions, buzz, happiness, but the President gavels for order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Silence! (it is silent) Captain Kirk, your new command awaits you. You and your crew have saved this planet from its own short-sightedness... And we are forever in your debt. The tide breaks loose: everyone in the great hall rises to a standing ovation for Kirk and the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the crowd is exiting. Kirk and the Crew are accepting the last handshakes and congratulations. Spirits are high. And Kirk suddenly turns to find himself face to face with Gillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own exonerated Kirk! I'm so.. juiced, I can't tell you! (she kisses him) Bye, Kirk... Thanks. She starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! -- Where you going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to your ship, I'm going to mine. Science Vessel. I've got 300 years of catch-up learning to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean this is -- goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed) Why does it have to be goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... As they say in your century -- I don't even have your phone number. How will I find you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'll find you. (then) See you around the galaxy... And she is gone. Kirk shakes his head in affection and disbelief, then turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: In a corner of the empty chamber, Spock waits stiffly as Sarek approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KIRK
dialogues.text: He sees, then waits discreetly, leaving them to talk alone.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK AND SAREK
dialogues.text: As the father reaches the Son. A quiet moment in the empty, echoing hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be returning to Vulcan within the hour... I wanted to take my leave of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is kind of you to make this effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not an effort. You are my son. (then, covering this emotionalism) Besides; I am most impressed with your performance in this -- crises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most kind, Father. Sarek looks at him uncertainly, wanting to hear some- thing. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I recall, I opposed your enlistment in Starfleet... It is possible that judgment was incorrect. (Spock, an eyebrow) Your associates are people of good character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course... Do you have any message for your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks; then) Tell her I feel fine... HOLD on Sarek. It is his turn to raise a Vulcan eyebrow. Now Spock crosses to the waiting Kirk. They share a moment, and depart together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Dock in the distance, amid the great SHIPS, a tiny SHUTTLECRAFT comes toward us slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great window in the front of the craft gives everyone a view of the ships and where they are headed. They do not seem to know.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDDOW
dialogues.text: Various vessels, odd shaped, undistinguished. A Reliant class, a Saratoga. As they watch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bureaucratic mentality is the only constant in the universe. We'll get a freighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all respect, Doctor, I'm counting on Excelsior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excelsior? Why in God's name would you want that bucket of bolts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, don't prejudge. A ship is a ship. Ahead, through the window, is Excelsior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, sir. (to himself) Thy will be done. And then, through the window screen, it happens: the shuttle, automated, begins a rising climb. The Excelsior DISAPPEARS BELOW THE FRAME LINE and in the near distance, a new SPACESHIP appears. It appears to be a Starship of the U.S.S. Constitution Class. The faces of Kirk and the crew light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPROACH - ILM It looks like the Enterprise. As we get closer, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ILM FAVORING the great dish; where in freshly painted letters: "U.S.S. ENTERPRISE" and on the line below, "NCC 1701 - A" A painter, in spacesuit waves cheerily.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE SHUTTLE
dialogues.text: The emotion is high from all, but very restrained. Kirk says it for all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends... We've come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great exit doors open. The U.S.S. Enterprise emerges and heads out on a trial run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shiny, new, refitted for anything that may come. And the crew is where they belong, all at their stations. And Kirk is in his Captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what she's got, Mr. Sulu.
